page.title: 02 CHANGES IN THE TOWN
page.content: 11 year old children who have always lived locally, can remember changes in the park, the new White Hart{Shopping} Arcade where there was once the hotel garage, the Market Hall Arcade on the site of the original Pannier Market and the Halifax Building Society replacing a large outfitter's shop. In 1984, we saw the Central Methodist Church Spire demolished because it was unsafe. J.B.Smith's garage by the Town Hall was closed. Near by a new bus stop and new road layouts have recently been completed. Fifty years ago there was a cold open-air swimming pool in Underlane and in nearby Newport an abattoir, a tannery and saddler's shop. Forty years ago Trecarrell, Woburn and Hurdon estates were started when people needed homes after the war. Then came more in Dunheved Road and St. Stephen's.
